intro: Pagiantha koroana var. salomonensis, commonly known as the Solomon Islands pagiantha, is a rare flowering plant native to the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded understory environments of tropical forests. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, waxy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
